?[1;31m Start test 2?[0m Scenario 'correct-statement' is started.
Good evening
Enter the first animal: > cat Enter the second animal: > dog Specify a fact that distinguishes a cat from a dog. The sentence should be of the format: 'It can/has/is ...'.
> It is a mammal Is it correct for a dog? Good evening
Enter the first animal: > cat Enter the second animal: > dog Specify a fact that distinguishes a cat from a dog. The sentence should be of the format: 'It can/has/is ...'.
> It can barks Is it correct for a dog? Good evening
Enter the first animal: > cat Enter the second animal: > dog Specify a fact that distinguishes a cat from a dog. The sentence should be of the format: 'It can/has/is ...'.
> It has a tail Is it correct for a dog? Good evening
Enter the first animal: > cat Enter the second animal: > dog Specify a fact that distinguishes a cat from a dog. The sentence should be of the format: 'It can/has/is ...'.
> IT IS A SHY ANIMAL Is it correct for a dog? Good evening
Enter the first animal: > cat Enter the second animal: > dog Specify a fact that distinguishes a cat from a dog. The sentence should be of the format: 'It can/has/is ...'.
> it CAN swim and fly Is it correct for a dog? Good evening
Enter the first animal: > cat Enter the second animal: > dog Specify a fact that distinguishes a cat from a dog. The sentence should be of the format: 'It can/has/is ...'.

Enter the first animal: > cat Enter the second animal: > dog Specify a fact that distinguishes a cat from a dog. The sentence should be of the format: 'It can/has/is ...'.

Enter the first animal: > cat Enter the second animal: > dog Specify a fact that distinguishes a cat from a dog. The sentence should be of the format: 'It can/has/is ...'.
> It is living in the forest. Is it correct for a dog? ?[1;31m Start test 3?[0m Scenario 'complete-scenario' is started.
Good evening
Enter the first animal: > cat Enter the second animal: > DOG Specify a fact that distinguishes a cat from a dog. The sentence should be of the format: 'It can/has/is ...'.
> It can climb trees Is it correct for a dog? > ha Oh, no, don't try to confuse me: say yes or no. > no I learned the following facts about animals: - The cat can climb trees. - The dog can't climb trees. I can distinguish these animals by asking the question: - Can it climb trees?
Goodbye Good evening
Enter the first animal: > hare Enter the second animal: > wolf Specify a fact that distinguishes a hare from a wolf. The sentence should be of the format: 'It can/has/is ...'.
> It is a shy animal Is it correct for a wolf? > nej I'm not sure I caught you: was it yes or no? > no I learned the following facts about animals: - The hare is a shy animal. - The wolf isn't a shy animal. I can distinguish these animals by asking the question: - Is it a shy animal?
See you later Good evening
Enter the first animal: > a lynx Enter the second animal: > an unicorN Specify a fact that distinguishes a lynx from an unicorn. The sentence should be of the format: 'It can/has/is ...'.
> It is a fabulous animal? Is it correct for an unicorn? > of c Funny, I still don't understand, is it yes or no? > yes I learned the following facts about animals: - The lynx isn't a fabulous animal. - The unicorn is a fabulous animal. I can distinguish these animals by asking the question: - Is it a fabulous animal?
See you later ?[1;31m Start test 4?[0m Scenario 'facts-and-question' is started.
Good evening
Enter the first animal: > cat Enter the second animal: > shark Specify a fact that distinguishes a cat from a shark. The sentence should be of the format: 'It can/has/is ...'.
> it is a mammal Is it correct for a shark? > no I learned the following facts about animals: - The cat is a mammal. - The shark isn't a mammal. I can distinguish these animals by asking the question: - Is it a mammal?
Goodbye Good evening
Enter the first animal: > wolf Enter the second animal: > hare Specify a fact that distinguishes a wolf from a hare. The sentence should be of the format: 'It can/has/is ...'.
> it is a shy animal Is it correct for a hare? > yes I learned the following facts about animals: - The wolf isn't a shy animal. - The hare is a shy animal. I can distinguish these animals by asking the question: - Is it a shy animal?
Bye bye! Good evening
Enter the first animal: > wolf Enter the second animal: > fox Specify a fact that distinguishes a wolf from a fox. The sentence should be of the format: 'It can/has/is ...'.
> it has a long bushy tail Is it correct for a fox? > yes I learned the following facts about animals: - The wolf doesn't have a long bushy tail. - The fox has a long bushy tail. I can distinguish these animals by asking the question: - Does it have a long bushy tail?
Bye Good evening
Enter the first animal: > dog Enter the second animal: > cat Specify a fact that distinguishes a dog from a cat. The sentence should be of the format: 'It can/has/is ...'.
> it can climb trees Is it correct for a cat? > yes I learned the following facts about animals: - The dog can't climb trees. - The cat can climb trees. I can distinguish these animals by asking the question: - Can it climb trees?
Bye Good evening
Enter the first animal: > dog Enter the second animal: > fox Specify a fact that distinguishes a dog from a fox. The sentence should be of the format: 'It can/has/is ...'.
> it is living in the forest Is it correct for a fox? > yes I learned the following facts about animals: - The dog isn't living in the forest. - The fox is living in the forest. I can distinguish these animals by asking the question: - Is it living in the forest?
See you later
